textReferFriendsDescription: Share the Link, Share Your Choices
textStandardReferralRules:
·When a friend buys or upgrades SBT pens, the inviter can get a 5% rebate of the friend’s purchase amount, and the rebate is point of the corresponding value. 
·The number of valid friends reaches 30, and the commission rate increases to 8%. 
·The number of valid friends reaches 100, and the commission rate increases to 11%. 
·The number of valid friends reaches 500, and the commission rate increases to 15%. 
·A valid user refers to the user who purchased the SBT pen.
textParticipationPrizeCouponRules: With the coupon in effect, a higher proportion of points can be obtained from sharing the Participation Prize Pool.
textWinPrizeCouponRules: With the coupon in effect, a higher proportion of points can be obtained from sharing the Majority Prize Pool.
textLikePrizeCouponRules: With the coupon in effect, divide the like prize pool to get a higher proportion of point(s).
textInvestmentPrizeCouponRules: With the coupon in effect, a higher proportion of points can be obtained from sharing the Support Prize Pool.
textMysteryReferralRules:
How can you get a Mystery Box? 
 1. Every time you refer a friend who then signs up and logs in, both of you are entitled to a Basic Mystery Box. 
 2. If your friend buys a Level 3 SBT Pen, both of you are entitled to an Advanced Mystery Box. 

What rewards can a Mystery Box offer? 
 1. A Basic Mystery Box may offer [Participation Prize Coupon], [Majority Prize Coupon], [Like Prize Coupon] or [Support Prize Coupon]. 
 2. An Advanced Mystery Box may offer points or NFT Pens. 

What can a coupon do? 
 You can use the coupon on the [Rewards] page to increase your earning rate the next time you participate in reward sharing.
textMysteryBoxReferralSlogan: Get Mystery Boxes and reward NFT

textNFTInvestmentDescription: The platform scans for the NFT Pens held in each user's wallet every day at UTC 00:00, and takes a snapshot of each user's NFT Pens for that day. The scan result indicates the point value that the user can support using NFTs on that day. Each Pen is worth {value1} points.Up to {value2} questions per day using NFT support.

textPenRuleBody1: Pens are must-haves to participate in Socrates activities, available in two types: SBT and NFT.
textPenRuleBody2: Issued in unlimited numbers, SBT Pens can be purchased and upgraded in Socrates. There can be only one SBT Pen for each wallet address. The higher the level of the pen, the higher the voting weight and earning rates.
textPenRuleBody3: After an SBT Pen is minted successfully, there will be a chance to get an NFT Pen additionally. NFT Pens are rare assets with their voting weight and earning rates equivalent to a Level 3 SBT Pen. The voting weight and earning rates for NFT Pens and SBT Pens can be combined. For more details, see Socrates White Paper.

titleBeginnerClass01: Tutorial 1 for beginners: How do answer rewards work?
textBeginnerClass0102: There are two types of answer rewards for the Discussion Prize. An individual can only receive one type of reward when answering a question.
textBeginnerClass0104: Criteria: After choosing an answer, a user is ranked within the top 100 among the participants who answered the question.
textBeginnerClass0105: Eligibility for rewards: Assuming you chose A, at the end of the question, option A receives the most votes. Then you will receive an award along with other users who vote for option A.
textBeginnerClass0106: Reward coefficients: Based on the type and number of Pens (coefficients of NFT Pens can be added together), the higher the level of the Pen, the greater the coefficient.
textBeginnerClass0107: Prize amount: Prize pool amount * 100/Total number of voters
textBeginnerClass0108: How do I understand the Type 1 Discussion Prize?
textBeginnerClass0109: This type of reward is distributed relatively evenly, that is, all winners share the prize pool together, and the only thing that causes different rewards is the Pens held by each winner.
textBeginnerClass0111: Criteria: After choosing an answer, a user is ranked after the 100th place among the participants who answered the question.
textBeginnerClass0112: Eligibility for rewards: Assuming you chose A, at the end of the question, the percentage of option A compared with that when you voted for it has 2 possibilities: 1. Up; 2. Down (but not more than 5%). In both cases, you will be awarded a prize.
textBeginnerClass0113: Reward coefficients: Coefficient 1: Based on the type and number of Pens (coefficients of NFT Pens can be added together), the higher the level of the Pen, the greater the coefficient. Coefficient 2: Based on the voting percentage increase of an option, the higher the increase, the greater the coefficient.
textBeginnerClass0114: Prize amount: Prize pool amount * (Total number of voters - 100)/Total number of voters
textBeginnerClass0115: How do I understand the Type 2 Discussion Prize?
textBeginnerClass0116: 1. This type of reward features a larger difference in reward distribution and is more competitive. Apart from the factor that users hold different Pens, the more important thing is the voting percentage increase of the option you voted for when a question ends*.
textBeginnerClass0117: 2. You may be awarded regardless of whether the option was the majority's choice or the minority's choice at the time of your vote.
textBeginnerClass0118: *At the early stage of voting, it's relatively easy to see a significant increase in voting when there are fewer participants. The closer the question is to the deadline, the harder it is to achieve the same increase. The algorithm introduces an additional voting stage coefficient to keep things balanced, ensuring that the calculation of the Type 2 reward is fair at any point in time.
textBeginnerClass0119: Next time, we will share how the Likes Prize and Reason Prize work.
